discoveredAssets: localhost:5000 - Flask/Werkzeug Python web application - Port 5000
http://localhost:5000/login - Login page with form authentication - Port 5000
http://localhost:5000/resource - File serving endpoint with filename parameter - Port 5000

targets.objective: Test for authentication vulnerabilities including SQL injection, NoSQL injection, default credentials, brute force attacks, session management flaws, and client-side validation bypass
targets.rationale: Login form is the primary authentication mechanism with client-side validation only. Always displays error message, indicating potential for credential attacks and authentication bypass

targets.objective: Test for path traversal, local file inclusion (LFI), directory traversal, and file disclosure vulnerabilities; attempt to access system files (/etc/passwd), configuration files (.env, .git), and application source code
targets.rationale: File serving endpoint accepts filename parameter which is commonly vulnerable to path traversal attacks. Critical for testing unauthorized file access and information disclosure

targets.objective: Test for CSRF vulnerabilities, redirect attacks, DOM-based XSS in redirection logic, and header-based vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Root endpoint performs automatic redirect to /login. Test for open redirect, CSRF in redirect mechanism, and other redirect-based attacks

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Vulnerable /resource endpoint - File serving endpoint accepts filename parameter, potential for path traversal and local file inclusion (LFI) attacks
[HIGH] Login form with client-side validation only - Form validation occurs in JavaScript, always displays error, vulnerable to authentication bypass and SQL injection attacks
[HIGH] No input validation apparent - /resource endpoint and login form lack proper input validation/sanitization
[MEDIUM] Flask/Werkzeug application - Version 3.1.3 with Python 3.13.3 identified, may have known vulnerabilities
[MEDIUM] No API documentation found - No swagger.json, openapi.json, or other API documentation endpoints discovered
[MEDIUM] Automatic redirect on root - Root endpoint redirects unauthenticated users to /login, potential for redirect-based attacks
